column5: I need to buy some 'bear' repellant...perhaps in this area one may encounter a 'bear'. My girlfriend likes to do some solo walks and meditation by the lake and I'd feel better if should could fend off a 'bear'. I found personal sized ones on the Cabela's site but don't know if customs would let it through. Anyone close to Niagara sell it?
try gun shops  al simmons on locke st in hamilton has it   edit: when you have had a few don't play with it, speaking from experience.
Dang Rick.... if you were going to the OFC Quinte trip I coulda brought you some!  G.
http://www.mec.ca/Products/product_detail....D=1195086199271  Should be at your front door in 5 days.  they sell holsters too.
I bought my wife some from trombays  in Orillia  a few years ago I would think they still sell it and it is much stronger then the dog repellent
Bear attractant I can help you with. Repellent, no.
Bear repellant doesn't work, Rick. Her best bet is to meditate with a friend who can't run as fast as her.
Good advice Roy. Works every time.
That would likely be me Roy..so I guess the repellent is for me...
You should be able to get some from Erie Tracker or Grimsby Tackle.  cd.
Any camping store.  Get the one under pressure.  I've tested that stuff ( not on a bear ) and its awesome.

When fishing the Athabasca we would do the "ling fling", we catch a ling and fling it into the woods to keep the bears back. when we got some eyes we go like ell for the road but sometimes we had to give one up on the way.  Throw food at em.
That might slow the rapist down...not sure though...
Try the Army Surplus stores as well.  It's amazing the stuff they'll have that no one else will.
I promise I'll leave her alone
Canadian Tire in Barrie sells it.  maybe the CTC down there ??

Whats the difference between a bear # 1 thatt attacks a human without bear repellant and a bear #2 that attacks a human who carries bear repellant?  The shiit from the bear #2 smells like bear repellant.
